intro: Tutcheria acutiserrata, commonly known as the sharp-toothed tutcheria, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, often displaying shades of red or purple. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
